Package lib.java_turtle

Class Turtle

java.lang.Object
lib.java_turtle.Turtle
public class Turtle extends Object
A turtle object is like a piece of pen, can draw on canvas while crawing

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Turtle(lib.java_turtle.Canvas canvas)
    constructor - create turtle at home location (0.0,0.0) and @ degree 0.0 pen color is initially black fill color is initially green pen size is initially 2.0

      Returns:

      Parameters:
      b_use_degrees - true if turtle using degrees

    • getHeading

      public double getHeading()
      Returns:
      current turtle heading direction either in radians or degrees depending on whether if turtle uses radians or degrees

    • setHeading

      public void setHeading(double heading)
      Parameters:
      heading - turtle heading direction either in radians or degrees depending on whether if turtle uses radians or degrees

    • setHeading

      public void setHeading(lib.java_turtle.Turtle.AngleUnit au, double heading)
      Parameters:
      au - either be AngleUnit.RADIANS or AngleUnit.DEGREES
      heading - set turtle heading direction value

    • getHeading

      public double getHeading(lib.java_turtle.Turtle.AngleUnit au)
      Parameters:
      au - either be AngleUnit.RADIANS or AngleUnit.DEGREES
      Returns:
      current turtle heading in provided angle unit as per au

      Parameters:
      steps - steps to move backward

    • circle

      public void circle(double x, double y, double dRadius, boolean bFill)
      Parameters:
      x - center x coordinate of the turtle on cartesian coordinate system
      y - center y coordinate of the turtle on cartesian coordinate system
      dRadius - radius of circle
      bFill - whether if the circle need to be drawn filled

    • circle

      public void circle(double dRadius, boolean bFollowTrack, boolean bFill)
      draw circle from current turtle coordinate
      Parameters:
      bFollowTrack - - if true, current turtle position and direction decide the tangent line to which the circle is drawn; if false, current turtle location is the center of the circle being drawn
      dRadius - radius of circle
      bFill - whether if the circle need to be drawn filled

    • arc

      public void arc(double x, double y, double dRadius, lib.java_turtle.Turtle.AngleUnit au, double a1, double a2)
      draw arc from coordinate
      Parameters:
      x - center x coordinate of the turtle on cartesian coordinate system
      y - center y coordinate of the turtle on cartesian coordinate system
      dRadius - radius of circle
      au - either be AngleUnit.RADIANS or AngleUnit.DEGREES
      a1 - start angle of the arc
      a2 - end angle of the arc

    • arc

      public void arc(double dRadius, lib.java_turtle.Turtle.AngleUnit au, double a1, double a2)
      draw arc from current turtle coordinate
      Parameters:
      dRadius - radius of circle
      au - either be AngleUnit.RADIANS or AngleUnit.DEGREES
      a1 - start angle of the arc
      a2 - end angle of the arc

    • arc

      public void arc(double x, double y, double dRadius, double a1, double a2)
      draw arc from coordinate
      Parameters:
      x - center x coordinate of the turtle on cartesian coordinate system
      y - center y coordinate of the turtle on cartesian coordinate system
      dRadius - radius of circle
      a1 - start angle of the arc, angle unit is degrees or radians depending on the choice of the turtle
      a2 - end angle of the arc, angle unit is degrees or radians depending on the choice of the turtle

    • arc

      public void arc(double dRadius, double a1, double a2)
      draw arc from current turtle coordinate
      Parameters:
      dRadius - radius of circle
      a1 - start angle of the arc, angle unit is degrees or radians depending on the choice of the turtle
      a2 - end angle of the arc, angle unit is degrees or radians depending on the choice of the turtle
